result.execSummary:
The defendant Adidas L Dawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Adidas L Dawson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adidas L Dawson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Adidas L Dawson was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Adidas L Dawson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Adidas L Dawson was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Adidas L Dawson was found guilty of Stalking [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Adidas L Dawson was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cts 1, 3 & 4 are concurrent, but Consecutive to Cts 5 & 6.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with Antoinette J, her residence, her family or her place of employment unless otherwise permitted by the court.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Court takes judicial notice of Exhibit 4 - JOC for 07CF1441 and sentencing arguments are made.  
Counts 1, 3 and 4 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years and Counts 1, 3 and 4 are Concurrent, but Consecutive to Counts 5 & 6.  See  conditions.  No contact with Antoinette J. unless permitted by the court only.  
Count 5 - DE is sentenced to 6 years in the WSP; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 322 days in Count 5 only.
Count 6 - DE is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP Consecutive to Count 1;  1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision.
DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. Any unpaid financial obligations that remain on all counts at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.    Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Exhibits S1-3 and S6-9 inventoried and place in Br. 1 exhibit room on 10/22/15. vm

DAY 2 - CONTINUED - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State and KPD Detective Traxler.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
Atty Barth moves to dismiss case and motion is denied.  Defense rests at 8:35 AM.  State's rebuttal witnesses: Jill O., KPD Detective Traxler and KSD Detective Martin and Antoinette J. are sworn in and testified.  Exhibits 2 and 6 thru 9 are received and evidence is closed.  Jury instructions given to the jurors and closing arguments are made.  Alternate Juror - Gabrielle C. released at 11:20 and Jury begins deliberation at 11:25 AM.  Verdict reached at 1:01 PM.  Jury finds DE Guilty in Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 and 6.  Jury finds DE Not Guilty in Count 2.  Jury is polled.  Defense moves for judgment not withstanding verdict.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  DE is adjudged Guilty in Counts 1,3, 4, 5 and 6 and is acquitted in Count 2.  State requests bond be revoked at this time.  Court increases bond to a $20,000 Cash Bond with same conditions.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 7/14/15 at 10:00 AM.
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Juror Seating Chart - Voir Dire

Same appearances but with change in court reporter in the afternoon to T. Czarnecki.
Parties stipulate to the judgment in Exhibit 4.  Testimony of Antoinette J. resumes.  Sworn in and testified are State's witnesses: Ashlee P., KSD Detective P. Martin and KPD Detective E. Traxler.  State rests at 3:02 PM.  DE is advised of his rights and elects to testify.  Defendant is sworn in and testified.  Court breaks for the day and jurors are instructed to return at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State and KPD Detective Traxler.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
State's motion to amend information is granted by the court.  Arguments heard on State's other acts motion and motions in limine.  Court renders decision on the motions.  Court orders sequestration of witnesses.  Jurors summoned and first oath is given to jury panel.  Voir Dire commences at 9:15 am and completed at 10:30.  Unselected jurors are released and selected jurors are sworn in.  Preliminary instructions are given to the jury and opening statements made.  Sworn in and testified is State's witness: Antoinette J.  Exhibits 1 and 3 are received.  Court breaks for lunch and jurors are instructed to return at 1:00 PM.
